intro: Schoenus laticulmis, commonly known as the broad-ribbed sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and grasses. The plant is characterized by its triangular, narrow leaves and produces small, greenish flowers in dense clusters. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Schoenus laticulmis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
